   19: %%
   20: -module(cpu_sup_SUITE).
   21: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   22: 
   23: %% Test server specific exports
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0]).
   25: -export([init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   26: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   27: 
   28: %% Test cases
   29: -export([load_api/1]).
   30: -export([util_api/1, util_values/1]).
   31: -export([port/1]).
   32: -export([terminate/1, unavailable/1, restart/1]).
   33: 
   34: init_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   35:     ok = application:start(os_mon),
   36:     Config.
   37: 
   38: end_per_suite(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   39:     ok = application:stop(os_mon),
   40:     Config.
   41: 
   42: init_per_testcase(unavailable, Config) ->
   43:     terminate(Config),
   44:     init_per_testcase(dummy, Config);
   45: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) ->
   46:     Config.
   47: 
   48: end_per_testcase(unavailable, Config) ->
   49:     restart(Config),
   50:     end_per_testcase(dummy, Config);
   51: end_per_testcase(_Case, _Config) ->
   52:     ok.
   53: 
   54: suite() ->
   55:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   56:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   57: 
   58: all() -> 
   59:     case os:type() of
   60:         {unix, sunos} ->
   61:             [load_api, util_api, util_values, port, unavailable];
   62:         {unix, linux} ->
   63:             [load_api, util_api, util_values, port, unavailable];
   64:         {unix, freebsd} ->
   65:             [load_api, util_api, util_values, port, unavailable];
   66:         {unix, openbsd} ->
   67:             [load_api, util_api, util_values, port, unavailable];
   68:         {unix, darwin} ->
   69:             [load_api, util_api, util_values, port, unavailable];
   70:         {unix, netbsd} -> [unavailable];
   71:         {unix, _OSname} -> [load_api];
   72:         _OS -> [unavailable]
   73:     end.
   74: 
   75: %% Test of load API functions
   76: load_api(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   77: 
   78:     %% nprocs()
   79:     N = cpu_sup:nprocs(),
   80:     true = is_integer(N),
   81:     true = N>0,
   82:     true = N<1000000,
   83: 
   84:     %% avg1()
   85:     Load1 = cpu_sup:avg1(),
   86:     true = is_integer(Load1),
   87:     true = Load1>0,
   88: 
   89:     %% avg5()
   90:     Load5 = cpu_sup:avg5(),
   91:     true = is_integer(Load5),
   92:     true = Load5>0,
   93: 
   94:     %% avg15()
   95:     Load15 = cpu_sup:avg15(),
   96:     true = is_integer(Load15),
   97:     true = Load15>0,
   98: 
   99:     ok.
  100: 
  101: %% Test of utilization API functions
  102: util_api(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  103:     %% Some useful funs when testing util/1
  104:     BusyP = fun({user, _Share}) -> true;
  105:                ({nice_user, _Share}) -> true;
  106:                ({kernel, _Share}) -> true;
  107:                ({hard_irq, _Share}) -> true;
  108:                ({soft_irq, _Share}) -> true;
  109:                (_) -> false
  110:             end,
  111:     NonBusyP = fun({wait, _Share}) -> true;
  112:                   ({idle, _Share}) -> true;
  113:                   ({steal, _Share}) -> true;
  114:                   (_) -> false
  115:                end,
  116:     Sum = fun({_Tag, X}, Acc) -> Acc+X end,
  117: 
  118:     %% util()
  119:     Util1 = cpu_sup:util(),
  120:     true = is_number(Util1),
  121:     true = Util1>0,
  122:     Util2 = cpu_sup:util(),
  123:     true = is_number(Util2),
  124:     true = Util2>0,
  125: 
  126:     %% util([])
  127:     {all, Busy1, NonBusy1, []} = cpu_sup:util([]),
  128:     true = tiny_diff(100.00, Busy1 + NonBusy1),
  129: 
  130:     %% util([detailed])
  131:     {Cpus2, Busy2, NonBusy2, []} = cpu_sup:util([detailed]),
  132:     true = lists:all(fun(X) -> is_integer(X) end, Cpus2),
  133:     true = lists:all(BusyP, Busy2),
  134:     true = lists:all(NonBusyP, NonBusy2),
  135:     true = tiny_diff(100.00, lists:foldl(Sum,0,Busy2)+lists:foldl(Sum,0,NonBusy2)),
  136: 
  137:     %% util([per_cpu])
  138:     [{Cpu3, Busy3, NonBusy3, []}|_] = cpu_sup:util([per_cpu]),
  139:     true = is_integer(Cpu3),
  140:     true = tiny_diff(100.00, Busy3 + NonBusy3),
  141: 
  142:     %% util([detailed, per_cpu])
  143:     [{Cpu4, Busy4, NonBusy4, []}|_] =
  144:     cpu_sup:util([detailed, per_cpu]),
  145:     true = is_integer(Cpu4),
  146:     true = lists:all(BusyP, Busy2),
  147:     true = lists:all(NonBusyP, NonBusy2),
  148:     true = tiny_diff(100.00, lists:foldl(Sum,0,Busy4)+lists:foldl(Sum,0,NonBusy4)),
  149: 
  150:     %% bad util/1 calls
  151:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch cpu_sup:util(detailed)),
  152:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch cpu_sup:util([detialed])),
  153: 
  154:     ok.
  155: 
  156: tiny_diff(A, B) ->
  157:     (abs(A - B) < 1.0e-11).
  158: 
  159: -define(SPIN_TIME, 1000).
  160: 
  161: spinner(Parent) ->
  162:     receive
  163:         stop -> Parent ! stopped
  164:     after 0 -> spinner(Parent)
  165:     end.
  166: 
  167: %% Test utilization values
  168: util_values(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  169:     NrOfProcessors =
  170:         case erlang:system_info(logical_processors_available) of
  171:             unknown -> 2;
  172:             X -> X
  173:         end,
  174:     Tester = self(),
  175:     Ref = make_ref(),
  176:     Spinner = fun () ->
  177:                       Spinner = self(),
  178:                       NrOfProcesses = NrOfProcessors,
  179:                       Loopers =
  180:                           [spawn_link(fun () -> spinner(Spinner) end)
  181:                            || _ <- lists:seq(1,NrOfProcesses)],
  182:                       receive after ?SPIN_TIME -> ok end,
  183:                       [begin
  184:                            Looper ! stop,
  185:                            receive stopped -> ok end
  186:                        end
  187:                        || Looper <- Loopers],
  188:                       Tester ! Ref
  189:               end,
  190:     Spin = fun () ->
  191:                    spawn_link(Spinner),
  192:                    receive Ref -> ok end
  193:            end,
  194:     cpu_sup:util(),
  195:     receive after ?SPIN_TIME -> ok end,
  196:     LowUtil0 = cpu_sup:util(),
  197:     case LowUtil0 of
  198:         U when U > ((100.0 / NrOfProcessors) * 0.33) ->
  199:             %% We cannot run this test if the system is doing other
  200:             %% work at the same time as the result will be unreliable
  201:             {skip, io_lib:format("CPU utilization was too high (~f%)", [LowUtil0])};
  202:         _ ->
  203:             cpu_sup:util(),
  204:             Spin(),
  205:             HighUtil1 = cpu_sup:util(),
  206: 
  207:             receive after ?SPIN_TIME -> ok end,
  208:             LowUtil1 = cpu_sup:util(),
  209: 
  210:             Spin(),
  211:             HighUtil2 = cpu_sup:util(),
  212: 
  213:             receive after ?SPIN_TIME -> ok end,
  214:             LowUtil2 = cpu_sup:util(),
  215: 
  216:             Utils = [{high1,HighUtil1}, {low1,LowUtil1},
  217:                      {high2,HighUtil2}, {low2,LowUtil2}],
  218:             io:format("Utils: ~p~n", [Utils]),
  219: 
  220:             false = LowUtil1 > HighUtil1,
  221:             false = LowUtil1 > HighUtil2,
  222:             false = LowUtil2 > HighUtil1,
  223:             false = LowUtil2 > HighUtil2,
  224: 
  225:             ok
  226:     end.
  227: 
  228: 
  229: % Outdated
  230: % The portprogram is now restarted if killed, and not by os_mon...
  231: 
  232: %% Test that cpu_sup handles a terminating port program
  233: port(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  234:     case cpu_sup_os_pid() of
  235:         {ok, PidStr} ->
  236:             %% Monitor cpu_sup
  237:             MonRef = erlang:monitor(process, cpu_sup),
  238:             N1 = cpu_sup:nprocs(),
  239:             true = N1>0,
  240: 
  241:             %% Kill the port program
  242:             case os:cmd("kill -9 " ++ PidStr) of
  243:                 [] ->
  244:                     %% cpu_sup should not terminate
  245:                     receive
  246:                         {'DOWN', MonRef, _, _, Reason} ->
  247:                             ct:fail({unexpected_exit_reason, Reason})
  248:                     after 3000 ->
  249:                               ok
  250:                     end,
  251: 
  252:                     %% Give cpu_sup time to restart cpu_sup port
  253:                     ct:sleep({seconds, 3}),
  254:                     N2 = cpu_sup:nprocs(),
  255:                     true = N2>0,
  256: 
  257:                     erlang:demonitor(MonRef),
  258:                     ok;
  259: 
  260:                 Line ->
  261:                     erlang:demonitor(MonRef),
  262:                     {skip, {not_killed, Line}}
  263:             end;
  264:         _ ->
  265:             {skip, os_pid_not_found }
  266:     end.
  267: 
  268: terminate(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  269:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, start_cpu_sup, false),
  270:     _ = supervisor:terminate_child(os_mon_sup, cpu_sup),
  271:     ok.
  272: 
  273: %% Test correct behaviour when service is unavailable
  274: unavailable(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  275: 
  276:     %% Make sure all API functions return their dummy values
  277:     0 = cpu_sup:nprocs(),
  278:     0 = cpu_sup:avg1(),
  279:     0 = cpu_sup:avg5(),
  280:     0 = cpu_sup:avg15(),
  281:     0 = cpu_sup:util(),
  282:     {all,0,0,[]} = cpu_sup:util([]),
  283:     {all,0,0,[]} = cpu_sup:util([detailed]),
  284:     {all,0,0,[]} = cpu_sup:util([per_cpu]),
  285:     {all,0,0,[]} = cpu_sup:util([detailed,per_cpu]),
  286: 
  287:     ok.
  288: 
  289: restart(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  290:     ok = application:set_env(os_mon, start_cpu_sup, true),
  291:     supervisor:restart_child(os_mon_sup, cpu_sup),
  292:     ok.
  293: 
  294: %% Aux
  295: 
  296: cpu_sup_os_pid() ->
  297:     Str = os:cmd("ps -e | grep '[c]pu_sup'"),
  298:     case io_lib:fread("~s", Str) of
  299:         {ok, [Pid], _Rest} -> {ok, Pid};
  300:         _ -> {error, pid_not_found}
  301:     end.
